channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AppLovin, top tech stock of the year, soars another 46% on earnings beat
item.description: AppLovin was already the best-performing tech stock of 2024, and that was before the stock popped on a big earnings beat.

item.title: Airbnb misses on earnings but squeaks in a revenue beat
item.description: Airbnb reported third-quarter earnings Thursday that showed revenue up 10% year over year.

item.title: Rivian lowers earnings guidance after missing Wall Street's third-quarter expectations
item.description: Rivian Automotive missed Wall Street's third-quarter expectations, including a massive difference in revenue of $116 million.

item.title: Warner Bros. Discovery adds 7.2 million Max subscribers, the streamer's largest single-quarter jump
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery said its streaming platform Max added 7.2 million subscribers during the third quarter.

item.title: Lucid slightly tops Wall Street's third-quarter expectations amid widening losses
item.description: The company's net loss for the third quarter widened to $992.5 million compared to a loss of $630.9 million a year earlier.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Falls as Storage Builds Continue
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures settled lower amid further storage builds ahead of the high-demand winter season, with inventories rising by 69 Bcf last week...

item.title: Nasdaq, S&P Gain as Fed Cuts Interest Rates
item.description: U.S. stocks finished mostly higher, extending post-election gains as the Federal Reserve delivered another rate cut.

item.title: Stocks Keep Climbing as Fed Cuts Rates
item.description: Big tech stocks push higher, while the financial and industrial sectors pull back after Wednesday’s big gains; Lyft jumps 22%.

item.title: Trump's New Wall Street Watchdogs Are Coming---Likely With a Lot Less Bite
item.description: The president-elect has said he would fire Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Gary Gensler “on day one.”

item.title: Goldman Sachs Opens the Door a Bit Wider to Its Prestigious Club of Partners
item.description: The class of partners is the fourth under CEO David Solomon.
